titleStmt.title: James R. Dupuy to James F. Robinson
CWG8871

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Louisville Ky June 5th
Gov' Robinson
Dear Sir

Judgement was obtained in our Jefferson Circuit Court against John Keenan & W C D Whips on the day of 1863 A scire facias issued, and on the 7th Apl 1863 execution issued for the sum of Four hundred Dollars & $915 costs which execution is returnable on the Saturday succeeding the first Monday in this month -- The time is short -- I write to say to your excellency that the offense charged in the indictment against the dft Thos Kent (whose bail Keenan & Whip were at the instance of W K Thomas jailer of Jefferson Co) was of rather an inferior grade, charged with stealing a small amount of property. W K Thomas is the party who will pay the execution, if not remitted and I believe
it will not damage the interest of the comth to remit said Judgemt & that the spirit of the law will not be infringed I had promised some time since to write this note to yr excellency, but by neglect have not heretofore done so If consistent with your sense of official duty, your excellency will oblige me by remitting the above & sending same to me by return of mail

Very Resptfly
J R Dupuy
Com Atty --
J. R. Dupuy Comths Atty Louisville asks remission of fines
The forfeiture & Judgt in the within case remitted

J F Robinson
send to J. R. Dupuy
Jno Keenan & W. C D Whips
Issd June 19. 1863
